text:
(CNN) Britney Spears, the Princess of Pop, is disrupting the Israeli political system -- in fact they moved an election date just for her.

The singer is set to perform her first concert in Tel Aviv on July 3, the same day as the Israeli Labor Party's primary election. Leave it to Britney to shake up international politics.

"We delayed the vote one day, to July 4. We couldn't hire enough security for the election because of the Britney Spears concert on July 3. There would also be a lot of traffic and roadblocks that would make it hard for the vote to go ahead," Labor Party spokesman Liron Zach said.

Security and traffic concerns prompted move

The primary election will decide who becomes chairman of the party. The elected official will then enter the running to be prime minister.

Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Britney Spears arrives for a movie premiere in Hollywood in July 2019. Hide Caption 1 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears, seen here with her parents in an old photo she posted to Instagram, was born December 2, 1981, in McComb, Mississippi. Hide Caption 2 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears, third from right, was part of "The Mickey Mouse Club" from 1993-1994. The Disney show had several cast members who have since become global superstars, including Ryan Gosling, seated next to Spears; and singers Christina Aguilera and Justin Timberlake, seen at right. Hide Caption 3 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears' first concert tour kicked off in November 1998, a couple of months before her first studio album was released. She signed a contract with Jive Records in 1997. She was 15 at the time. Hide Caption 4 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs at the 1999 MTV Video Music Awards. Her first album "...Baby One More Time," had become a smash hit. Hide Caption 5 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears poses with the boy band NSYNC, who she once toured with, in 1999. NSYNC included her former "Mickey Mouse Club" castmate Justin Timberlake, seen at bottom left. Hide Caption 6 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears holds a doll of herself in 1999. Hide Caption 7 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs at the MTV Video Music Awards in 2000. Hide Caption 8 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears and Timberlake attend the American Music Awards together in 2001. The two dated for a few years. Hide Caption 9 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs with Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler as part of the Super Bowl halftime show in 2001. Hide Caption 10 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears holds a snake while performing at the 2001 MTV Video Music Awards. Hide Caption 11 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears and her sister, Jamie Lynn, attend the Teen Choice Awards in 2002. Hide Caption 12 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears stars in the 2002 movie "Crossroads" with Taryn Manning and Zoe Saldana. That year, Forbes magazine named her Hollywood's Most Powerful Celebrity. Hide Caption 13 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears In 2003, Spears and Madonna set tongues wagging as they kissed during the opening performance of the MTV Video Music Awards. Hide Caption 14 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears joins Beyonce and Pink for the filming of a Pepsi commercial in Rome in 2003. Hide Caption 15 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2003. Hide Caption 16 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears married dancer Kevin Federline in 2004. They had two sons together before divorcing in 2007. Hide Caption 17 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears The front page of the New York Daily News shows Spears with a shaved head in 2007. Headlines at the time focused on whether the star was in the midst of a breakdown. Hide Caption 18 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs at the MTV Video Music Awards in 2007. Hide Caption 19 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears leaves a Los Angeles courthouse after a child custody hearing in 2007. A few months later, she was hospitalized over issues involving the custody of her children. Federline, her ex-husband, was awarded sole custody. In February 2008, a Los Angeles court granted temporary conservatorship to Spears' father, Jamie, after Britney was taken to a hospital and deemed unable to take care of herself. Hide Caption 20 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs on the opening night of her tour in 2009. Hide Caption 21 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears In 2012, Spears became a judge on the TV show "The X Factor." Hide Caption 22 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears poses with her sons -- Jayden, left, and Sean -- at a Los Angeles Dodgers baseball game in 2013. Hide Caption 23 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears unveils a line of intimate apparel in 2014. Hide Caption 24 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Clark County, Nevada, proclaimed November 5, 2014, as "Britney Day" on the Las Vegas Strip. In 2013, Spears started a two-year residency at the Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino in Las Vegas. Hide Caption 25 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs at her Las Vegas show "Britney: Piece of Me" in 2015. Hide Caption 26 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears speaks during the Teen Choice Awards in 2015. Hide Caption 27 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears joins late-night talk show host James Corden for some "carpool karaoke" in 2016. Hide Caption 28 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears performs at the MTV Video Music Awards in 2016. Hide Caption 29 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears gets a birthday cake at the Jingle Ball event in Los Angeles in 2016. Hide Caption 30 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears accepts the Vanguard Award at the GLAAD Media Awards in 2018. The award goes to a performer who has made a difference in promoting and supporting equality. Hide Caption 31 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears appears with Jimmy Fallon in a "Tonight Show" sketch in 2018. Hide Caption 32 of 33 Photos: Pop icon Britney Spears Spears and her boyfriend Sam Asghari attend a Hollywood premiere in 2019. A couple of months earlier, she had checked out of a mental-health treatment facility after undertaking an "all-encompassing wellness treatment." Hide Caption 33 of 33
